intro: Wissadula densiflora var. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered wissadula, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit and fleshy, often blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to orange in color. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in arid gardens and rockeries.
